docs.snippet: A roundup of some of the most popular but completely untrue headlines of the week. None of these stories is legit, even though they were shared widely on social media. The Associated Press checked these out; here are the real facts:

headline.print_headline: NOT REAL NEWS: A Look at What Didn't Happen This Week
headline.main: NOT REAL NEWS: A Look at What Didn't Happen This Week

docs.snippet: Britain called on Israel to improve the treatment of Palestinian children in military detention on Friday and said Israel should do more to safeguard vulnerable people in its care.

headline.print_headline: Britain Urges Israel to Improve Treatment of Detained Palestinian Children
headline.main: Britain Urges Israel to Improve Treatment of Detained Palestinian Children

docs.snippet: Meyers and other hosts had fun speculating about how actual fisticuffs between the tough-talking political septuagenarians would play out.

headline.print_headline: Seth Meyers on Trump vs. Biden: ‘Can You Imagine That Fight?’
headline.main: Seth Meyers on Trump vs. Biden: ‘Can You Imagine That Fight?’

docs.snippet: A teenage Palestinian girl who was filmed kicking and slapping an Israeli soldier in the occupied West Bank accepted a plea deal on Wednesday under which she will be sentenced to eight months in prison, her lawyer said.

headline.print_headline: Palestinian Teen on Trial for Striking Israeli Soldier Agrees Plea Deal
headline.main: Palestinian Teen on Trial for Striking Israeli Soldier Agrees Plea Deal

docs.snippet: The chef Ilene Rosen’s new book, “Saladish,” redefines what a salad can be, using modern combinations of ingredients, textures and tastes.

headline.print_headline: Not Strictly Salad, but Close Enough
headline.main: Not Strictly Salad, but Close Enough

docs.snippet: European Union leaders gave a cautious welcome on Thursday to news that U.S. President Donald Trump had decided not to apply tariffs to European steel and aluminum but said they were waiting for Washington to confirm that decision.

headline.print_headline: EU Leaders Receive Positive News on Trump Tariffs
headline.main: EU Leaders Receive Positive News on Trump Tariffs

docs.snippet: Mr. Lamo, who was also known for hacking into the computer network of The New York Times, was reviled and revered for turning in Ms. Manning to the authorities.

headline.print_headline: Adrián Lamo, 37, Hacker Who Turned In Manning
headline.main: Adrián Lamo, Hacker Who Reported Chelsea Manning to the F.B.I., Dies at 37

docs.snippet: Federal investigators on Thursday combed through the home of the 23-year-old they say was behind this month's deadly Texas bombing spree, seeking clues about what motivated his attacks the day after he killed himself in a confrontation with police...

headline.print_headline: Investigators Scour Texas Bomber's Home, Searching for a Motive
headline.main: Investigators Scour Texas Bomber's Home, Searching for a Motive

docs.snippet: Austria's foreign ministry has recalled an employee of its embassy in Israel after an Austrian weekly said he posted a picture of himself on social media wearing a T-shirt bearing the name of a Nazi tank division.

headline.print_headline: Austria Recalls Embassy Employee From Israel Over Nazi Shirt
headline.main: Austria Recalls Embassy Employee From Israel Over Nazi Shirt

docs.snippet: Steel-cut oats, toasted in brown butter and cooked with unsweetened cocoa, makes the average bowl of porridge all the more sophisticated.

headline.print_headline: Yes, Adults Can Have Chocolate for Breakfast. Really.
headline.main: Yes, Adults Can Have Chocolate for Breakfast. Really.
